content:
Initial creation of the topic for Backdrop Upgrade Status.

@StPaulTim let's use this to do some collaboration on this topic.

I'm curious what your thoughts are on tying the telemetry from this module in with the Backdrop telemetry initiative vs creating a small, crude but focused collection site to retrieve and output the collected data?

One thought is to add the telemetry into BUS (Backdrop Upgrade Status) and start sending it "somewhere", and later incorporate it into the overall initiative collection site later.

Another thought is to leave it all housed on the crude site and sandbox this from the initiative. (My vote) This information has a date limit on it and as people move away from D7, the need for this info becomes less and less to the point of shutting it down.

For right now, let's figure out if we pool it all together or treat this as a completely separate project. This decision will help determine how involved you need to be.

@klonos you seem to be interested in this as well so your thoughts are more than welcome.
Do we have a github issue for this specific idea yet?
Uhh... Lemme check... I've slept since then.

Yes: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/backdrop_upgrade_status/issues/6

I need to rename it. (doing that now)

Renamed to: Add telemetry to Backdrop Upgrade Status

Add link/button to send b.org a list of modules used on the respective site. · Issue #6 · backdrop-contrib/backdrop_upgrade_status
Forgive me if this is already available, I haven't tried this module out yet. The idea, is to have a link or button or maybe even just send upon being enabled, a mechanism where the site submit...
I've added a bunch of thoughts to the backdrop_upgrade_status module issue queue.

https://twitter.com/backdropcms/status/1339589921766445056

We've released a Drupal 7 module to help you determine if your Drupal 7 website can be upgraded (easily) to Backdrop CMS. The module will compile a list of your projects along with the status of Backdrop CMS equivalents. https://www.drupal.org/project/backdrop_upgrade_status Testing and feedback wanted.

- Backdrop CMS (@backdropcms)

@docwilmot I don't think you were able to listen to the discussion about adding telemetry to BUS, but it was decided that we a) don't need a separate Backdrop endpoint site and b) we don't need to house the data on b.org

There are two suggestions floating about where to store the data 1) standalone sql database 2) a Google sheet

We basically just need a standalone script that can "listen" for the incoming data and send it to the database.

Have any thoughts so far?
@Phil Ward - Can you write a summary of our discussion in the issue?
@Joseph Flatt you had some good thoughts on this as well. Feel free to chime in.
@StPaulTim yes. I've been planning to get this going once I have some solid direction.
The discussion today has narrowed that down significantly so yay!
@Phil Ward - However you choose to do it. But, I was thinking a summary of what was discussed in the meeting today, regardless of what decision get's made.

This Twitter user is wondering where the best place is to give feedback on the Backdrop CMS Upgrade Module. https://twitter.com/Bevan_67/status/1339768493621694464

@backdropcms Nice addition to the migration process. Were is the best place to provide feedback?

- Bevan Calliess (@Bevan_67)

Is it best to post issues in the Drupal.org issue queue or on Github?

Drupal - Open Source CMS
Drupal - the leading open-source CMS for ambitious digital experiences that reach your audience across multiple channels. Because we all have different needs, Drupal allows you to create a unique space in a world of cookie-cutter solutions.
I don't think we should expect Drupal users to use GitHub, at least not until they've made the switch.

I agree with @BWPanda

That said, I think git would still be good to use internally for tracking the actual coding issues and dealing with backend discussion (since it's familiar to the BD community). It's double work to a degree, but basically all of the backend chatter can stay on git and the frontend discussion can stay on d.org. That way we can test it a bit before anything gets pushed to d.org and we can keep general chatter such as support requests over there as well. It's an idea.

I've created an issue this evening for BUS that seems to be pretty nasty. The title is mis-leading and needs renamed since I only got those errors at the beginning of my testing but since I'm not sure what the actual problem is, (only how to replicate it) I don't know what to title it. Curious if anyone else is running into the same thing.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/backdrop_upgrade_status/issues/16

@docwilmot or @Herb mind checking into it? I think it's going to take some coding expertise to figure out.

Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent · Issue #16 · backdrop-contrib/backdrop_upgrade_status
Getting an error: Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent when trying to manually run BUS on one of my sites. I think it's generating an error per module installed. It ...

StPaulTim said:

Phil Ward - However you choose to do it. But, I was thinking a summary of what was discussed in the meeting today, regardless of what decision get's made.

Do you have anywhere in mind where this should be shared? I've got a Google doc created for it, but I don't know if I should just share what I have or or if there's a more official place where it would make sense (like on git maybe?)

BUS module in its current form is broken and needs some eyes.

I have an issue detailing the steps to reproduce and @Laryn said he can confirm the issue.

I'll update the title as soon as someone can tell me what is actually going on with it.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/backdrop_upgrade_status/issues/16

Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent · Issue #16 · backdrop-contrib/backdrop_upgrade_status
Getting an error: Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent when trying to manually run BUS on one of my sites. I think it's generating an error per module installed. It ...
I'm not sure what's going on either. We could compare it with the original, Upgrade Status. And see if it has the same error. And compare the code
ping @jenlampton

Ugh, I'm making a mess...

Update The two links to focus on in order:

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/backdrop_upgrade_status/issues/16

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/backdrop_upgrade_status/issues/12

I believe issue 16 will fix issue 12

Note: Feel free to update the title to #16 or let me know a better title to describe the actual problem.

Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent · Issue #16 · backdrop-contrib/backdrop_upgrade_status
Getting an error: Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent when trying to manually run BUS on one of my sites. I think it's generating an error per module installed. It ...
Backdrop Upgrade Status Conflicts With automatic_updates · Issue #12 · backdrop-contrib/backdrop_upgrade_status
This is here more as a PSA than a request for fix. I was testing the Drupal Automatic Updates module on one of my sites and ran into an interesting bug where "if" a module has conflicts w...
Remove forum module · Issue #16 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
sub-issue from #7
